title: Edge Case Discovery Simulator
description: An interactive physics simulation where students experiment with parameter boundaries to identify edge cases including negative gravity, oversized objects, energy conservation violations, and tunneling effects.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Software Testing
Edge Cases
Quality Assurance
Physics Simulation
learningObjectives: Define what constitutes an edge case in software systems
Identify edge cases by experimenting with parameter boundaries
Explain why edge case testing is important for software quality
Predict potential edge cases given a system specification

controls.name: Gravity
controls.description: Controls gravitational acceleration; negative values cause upward 'falling'

controls.name: Ball Radius
controls.description: Sets the ball size; large values create oversized ball edge case

controls.name: Bounciness
controls.description: Coefficient of restitution; values above 1 cause energy gain

controls.name: Initial Speed
controls.description: Starting velocity magnitude; extreme values may cause tunneling

controls.name: Log State
controls.description: Saves current parameters and ball state to the edge case log

controls.name: Reset
controls.description: Returns all parameters to default values

controls.name: Restart Ball
controls.description: Relaunches the ball from center with current speed setting

limitations: Does not simulate realistic multi-body physics
Performance edge cases depend on hardware
Tunneling detection is reactive rather than preventive
